repnme.cdata!:
Iraq - Emergency Baghdad Water Supply and
            Sanitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Baghdad Water Supply and
            Sanitation Project for Iraq had a satisfactory outcome, with
            the performances of both the Bank as well as the borrower
            deemed to be moderately satisfactory. Most of the project
            development objective indicators and the intermediate
            outcome indicators were achieved fully or nearly met the
            target, while some indicators were dropped. Significant
            lessons learned during the course of implementing the
            project were: 1) the Bank's tools to mitigate risks
            were limited in Iraq, when the post-conflict environment did
            not materialize; 2) trade-offs between risk mitigation
            measures and speed of achievement of development outcomes
            need to be examined; 3) the Bank should expand the role and
            scope of the Fiduciary Monitoring Agent (FMA) to respond
            effectively to the ground realities; 4) capacity building
            should not be bundled with technical assistance; 5) conflict
            situations calls for thinking about monitoring and
            evaluation differently; and 6) the cost of doing business in
            conflict areas is high.

repnme.cdata!:
Iraq - Emergency Baghdad Water Supply and
            Sanitation Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency Baghdad
            Water Supply and Sanitation Project for Iraq is to assist in
            restoring basic water supply and sanitation services for the
            capital city of Baghdad through: the reconstruction and
            rehabilitation of existing priority networks and treatment
            facilities and providing capacity building support through
            training and technical assistance. This restructuring paper
            aims to reallocate the trust fund proceeds to facilitate
            project implementation. Indicators in the results framework
            will be revised to include the sector core indicators to
            better reflect project outcomes.

display_title.display_title:
Iraq - Emergency Baghdad Water
            Supply and Sanitation Project : restructuring : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Iraq - Emergency Baghdad Water Supply and
            Sanitation Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the Emergency
            Baghdad Water Supply and Sanitation Project is to assist in
            restoring basic water supply and sanitation services for the
            capital city of Baghdad through: the reconstruction and
            rehabilitation of existing priority networks and treatment
            facilities, and providing capacity building support through
            training and technical assistance. The extension of the
            closing date by 18 months will allow for completion of
            ongoing contracts and for the disbursement of the remaining
            available trust fund amount; while the reallocation of funds
            is needed to reflect the changes made to the rehabilitation
            and renewal of Sadr City sewerage network sub-project. The
            closing date needs to be extended from December 31, 2011
            until June 30, 2013.

display_title.display_title:
Iraq - Emergency Baghdad Water
            Supply and Sanitation Project : restructuring : Main report
